description.narrative: The project aims at integrating the pygme minority to the society through supporting education opportunities for pygme children in the Republic of Congo Moutamba District in the village of Tsimba and its surrounding smaller villages. The foundation of the project is based on good collaboration with local education health and other district authorities in addition to the village committee and the local Parent-Teacher Associations (PTA). It is essential that the whole community benefits from the project not j ust pygmies. A pilot phase of the project improved school facilities built latrines and water points refurbished schools. In the second phase the aim is to continue supporting the local schools and their teachers providing health care to the students from the local health center and improving the health of the population by building a well to Tsimba which will decrease water-born diseases. A media center an intiative of the local education director will be built to Tsimba. The center will provide children a nd youth an educational and learning environment where books dvds and other materials will be made available. The aim is to encourage the children and youth to continue their studies and to get familiar with the world of books and information. The project' s objective is to support the integration of pygmies to the community. School is a very good place to promote the integration of a minority group as children parents and teachers learn to work with each other in an everyday setting. The local authorities h ave been and will continue to be sensitized on minority rights by the project.
